title: [Large-scale] Advanced Learning of Rational Numbers and Fraction Concepts: Adaptive Digital Tutoring-Based Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental fraction operation skills at elementary/middle school level
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended learning environment combining in-person lectures and digital tutoring systems, including experimental activities using virtual manipulation tools

learning_goals: Learners can explain fraction equivalence, magnitude comparison, and operational rules with 90% accuracy
Learners enhance their ability to transform abstract concepts of rational numbers into concrete contexts using virtual manipulatives
Learners improve fraction problem-solving accuracy by over 30% by incorporating feedback from an adaptive digital tutor
Learners can provide at least three examples of fraction applications in real-life contexts (e.g., budget allocation, ratio calculations)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
